_header: When Rome is removed into England
Note: All MSS show considerable variations, but derive from an original short prophecy, Scottish in sympathy, developing some of the symbols used by Geoffrey of Monmouth.
_description: The Second Scottish Prophecy, the C Text — in couplets

BLCottCleoCIV.First Lines:
When Rome is removith into englondAnd ilke prest haiit the pope is
                    poure in hand…
BLCottCleoCIV.Last Lines:
…To bring out of brawlis the kynd blod of brutesThe which
                    schalt lyue on to lyue of landes
BLCottCleoCIV.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
